title: Biodegradable polymers, preparation thereof and use thereof for producing biodegradable moldings

events.title: First worldwide family litigation filed

classifications.description: Starch; Degradation products thereof, e.g. dextrin
Polycondensates having carboxylic or carbonic ester groups in the main chain

Polycondensates having carboxylic or carbonic ester groups in the main chain containing cyclic groups containing aromatic groups derived from aromatic dicarboxylic acids and dialcohols from mixtures or combinations of aromatic dicarboxylic acids and aliphatic dicarboxylic acids and dialcohols

Polycondensates having carboxylic or carbonic ester groups in the main chain containing cyclic groups containing aromatic groups derived from aromatic dicarboxylic acids and dialcohols from aromatic dicarboxylic acids and dialcohols in combination with polycarboxylic acids and/or polyhydroxy compounds which are at least trifunctional
Caprolactone and/or substituted caprolactone
Lactides

Polycondensates having carboxylic or carbonic ester groups in the main chain prepared from hydroxycarboxylic acids and/or lactones prepared from a combination of hydroxycarboxylic acids and/or lactones with polycarboxylic acids or ester forming derivatives thereof and polyhydroxy compounds
Polycondensates having carboxylic or carbonic ester groups in the main chain having heteroatoms other than oxygen containing sulfur
Compounds of group C08G18/42 with compounds of group C08G18/34
Polyesters having been prepared in the presence of compounds having one reactive group or more than two reactive groups

Polyesters derived from hydroxycarboxylic acids or from polycarboxylic acids and polyhydroxy compounds derived from the reaction of a mixture of hydroxy carboxylic acids, polycarboxylic acids and polyhydroxy compounds
Polyurethanes from polyesters
Coating compositions based on polyesters obtained by reactions forming a carboxylic ester link in the main chain; Coating compositions based on derivatives of such polymers
Mulches
Compositions for preparing biodegradable polymers
Adaptation technologies in agriculture, forestry, livestock or agroalimentary production in agriculture specially adapted for farming

abstract: Biodegradable polyesters P1 obtainable by the reaction of a mixture consisting essentially of (al) a mixture essentially of 35 to 95 mol% adipic acid or ester-forming derivatives thereof or mixtures thereof, 5 to 65 mol% terephthalic acid or ester-forming derivatives thereof or mixtures thereof, and 0 to 5 mol% of a sulphonate group-containing compound in which the sum of the individual mol percentages is 100, and (a2) a dihydroxy compound selected from the group consisting of C2-C6 alkane diols and C5-C10 cycloalkane diols, in which the molar ratio of (a1) and (a2) is in the range from 0.4:1 to 1.5:1, provided that the polyester P1 have a molecular weight (M n) in the range from 5000 to 50,000 g/mol, a viscosity index in the range from 30 to 350 g/ml (measured in o-dichlorobenzole/phenol (in a ratio by weight of 50/50) at a concentration of 0.5 wt.% polyester P1 at a temperature of 25 °C) and a melting point in the range from 50 to 170 °C, and with the further proviso that from 0.01 to 5 mol% in relation to the molar quantity of the component (a1) used of compound D with at least three groups capable of forming esters are used to produce the polyesters P1, and other biodegradable polymers and thermoplastic moulding compounds and adhesives, biodegradable mouldings, foams and blends with starch obtainable from the polymers or moulding compounds of the invention.
claims: 1. Biodegradable polyesters P1 obtained by reaction of a mix-ture consisting essentially of (a1) a mixture consisting essentially of from 35 to 95 mol% of adipic acid or ester-forming derivatives thereof or mixtures thereof, from 5 to 65 mol% of terephthalic acid or ester-forming derivatives thereof or mixtures thereof, and from 0 to 5 mol% of a sulfonate compound, the sum of the individual mole percentages being 100 mol%, and (a2) a dihydroxy compound selected from the group con-sisting of C2-C6-alkanediols and C5-C10-cyclo-alkanediols, the molar ratio of (a1) to (a2) being chosen within the range from 0.4:1 to 1.5:1, with the proviso that the polyesters P1 have a molecular weight (M n) within the range from 5000 to 50,000 g/mol, a viscosity number within the range from 30 to 350 g/ml (measured in 50:50 w/w o-dichlorobenzene/phenol at a concentration of 0.5% by weight of polyester P1 at 25°C) and a melting point within the range from 50 to 170°C and with the further proviso that the polyesters P1 are prepared using from 0.01 to 5 mol%, based on the molar quantity used of component (a1), of a compound D having at least three groups capable of ester formation.

2. Biodegradable polyesters P2 obtained by reaction of a mix-ture consisting essentially of (b1) a mixture consisting essentially of from 20 to 95 mol% of adipic acid or ester-forming derivatives thereof or mixtures thereof, from 5 to 80 mol% of terephthalic acid or ester-forming derivatives thereof or mixtures thereof, and from 0 to 5 mol% of a sulfonate compound, the sum of the individual mole percentages being 100 mol%, (b2) dihydroxy compound (a2), the molar ratio of (b1) to (b2) being chosen within the range from 0.4:1 to 1.5:1, (b3) from 0.01 to 100% by weight, based on component (b1), of a hydroxycarboxylic acid B1, and (b4) from 0 to 5 mol%, based on component (b1), of compound D, having at least three groups capable of ester formation, the hydroxycarboxylic acid B1 being defined by the formula Ia or Ib  where p is an integer from 1 to 1500, r is an integer from 1 to 4, and G is a radical selected from the group consisting of phenylene, -(CH2)n-, where n is an integer from 1 to 5, -C(R)H- and -C(R)HCH2, where R is methyl or ethyl, the polyesters P2 having a molecular weight (M n) within the range from 5000 to 80,000 g/mol, a viscosity number within the range from 30 to 450 g/ml (measured in 50:50 w/w o-dichlorobenzene/phenol at a concentration of 0.5% by weight of polyester P2 at 25°C) and a melting point within the range from 50 to 235°C.

3. Biodegradable polyesters Q1 obtained by reaction of a mix-ture consisting essentially of (c1) polyester P1 as claimed in claim 1, and/or a polyester PWD, (c2) from 0.01 to 50% by weight, based on (c1), of hydroxycarboxylic acid B1, and (c3) from 0 to 5 mol%, based on component (a1) as claimed in claim 1, from the preparation of Pl as claimed in claim 1, and/or PWD, of compound D as claimed in claim 1, having at least three groups capable of ester formation, the polyester PWD being obtained by reaction of essentially components (a1) as claimed in claim 1, and (a2) as claimed in claim 1, the molar ratio of (a1) to (a2) being chosen within the range from 0.4:1 to 1.5:1, with the proviso that the polyesters PWD have a molecular weight (M n) within the range from 5000 to 50,000 g/mol, a viscosity number within the range from 30 to 350 g/ml (measured in 50:50 w/w o-dichloro-benzene/phenol at a concentration of 0.5 o by weight of polyester PWD at 25°C) and a melting point within the range from 50 to 170°C, the polyesters Q1 having a molecular weight (Mn) within the range from 5000 to 100,000 g/mol, a viscosity number within the range from 30 to 450 g/ml (measured in 50:50 w/w o-dichlorobenzene/ phenol at a concentration of 0.5% by weight of polyester Q1 at 25°C) and a melting point within the range from 50 to 235°C.

4. Biodegradable polyester Q2 having a molecular weight (M n) within the range from 6000 to 60,000 g/mol, a viscosity number within the range from 30 to 350 g/ml (measured in 50:50 w/w o-dichlorobenzene/phenol at a concentration of 0.5% by weight of polyester Q2 at 25°C) and melting point within the range from 50 to 170°C and obtained by reaction of a mixture consisting essentially of:(d1) from 95 to 99.9% by weight of polyester P1 as claimed in claim 1, and/or polyester PWD as set forth in claim 3, (d2) from 0.1 to 5% by weight of a diisocyanate C1, and (d3) from 0 to 5 mol%, based on component (al) as claimed in claim 1, from the preparation of P1 as claimed in claim 1, and/or PWD as claimed in claim 3, of compound D as claimed in claim 1, having at least three groups capable of ester formation.

5. Biodegradable polymers T1 having a molecular weight (Mn) within the range from 10,000 to 100,000 g/mol, a viscosity number within the range from 30 to 450 g/ml (measured in 50:50 w/w o-dichlorobenzene/phenol at a concentration of 0.5% by weight of polymer T1 at 25°C) and a melting point within the range from 50 to 235°Cand obtained by reaction of polyester Q1 as set forth in claim 3 with (e1) from 0.1 to 5% by weight, based on polyester Q1 as claimed in claim 3, of diisocyanate C1 and also with (e2) from 0 to 5 mol%, based on component (al) as claimed in claim 1, from the preparation of polyester Q1 as claimed in claim 3, via polyester P1 as claimed in claim 1, and/or PWD as claimed in claim 3, of compound D as claimed in claim 1, having at least three groups capable of ester formation.

6. Biodegradable polymers T2 having a molecular weight (M n) within the range from 10,000 to 100,000 g/mol, a viscosity number within the range form 30 to 450 g/ml (measured in 50:50 w/w o-dichlorobenzene/phenol at a concentration of 0.5% by weight of polymer T2 at 25°C) and a melting point within the range form 50 to 235°Cand obtained by reaction of polyester Q2 as claimed in claim 4, with:(f1) from 0.01 to 50% by weight, based on polyester Q2 as claimed in claim 4, of hydroxycarboxylic acid B1 and also with (f2) from 0 to 5 mol%, based on component (a1) as claimed in claim 1, from the preparation of polyester Q2 as claimed in claim 4, via polyester P1 as claimed in claim 1, and/or PWDas claimed in claim 3 , of compound D having at least three groups capable of ester formation.

7. Biodegradable polymers T3 having a molecular weight (M n) within the range from 10,000 to 100,000 g/mol, a viscosity number within the range from 30 to 450 g/ml (measured in 50:50 w/w o-dichlorobenzene/phenol at a concentration of 0.5% by weight of polymer T3 at 25°C) and a melting point within the range from 50 t 235°Cand obtained by reaction of:(g1) polyester P2 as claimed in claim 2, or (g2) a mixture consisting essentially of polyester P1 as claimed in claim 1, and from 0.01 to 50%              by weight, based on polyester P1 as claimed in claim 1, of hydroxycarboxylic acid B1, or (g3) a mixture consisting essentially of polyesters P1 as claimed in claim 1, which have mutually different compositions, with from 0.1 to 5% by weight, based on the amount of polyesters used, of diisocyanate C1 and also with from 0 to 5 mol%, based on the respective molar quantities of (al) as claimed in claim 1, used for preparing the polyesters (g1) to (g3) used, of compound D having at least three groups capable of ester formation.

8. Biodegradable thermoplastic molding compositions T4 obtained by mixing of (h1) from 99.5 to 0.5% by weight of polyester P1 as set forth in claim 1 or polyester Q2 as set forth in claim 4 or polyester PWD as set forth in claim 3, with;(h2) from 0.5 to 99.5% by weight of hydroxycar-boxylic acid B1.

9. A process for preparing the biodegradable polyesters P1 of claim 1, which comprises reacting a mixture consisting essentially of (al) a mixture consisting essentially of from 35 to 95 mol% of adipic acid or ester-forming derivatives thereof or mixtures thereof, from 5 to 65 mol% of terephthalic acid or ester-forming derivatives thereof or mixtures thereof, and from 0 to 5 mol% of a sulfonate compound, the sum of the individual mole percentages being 100 mol%, and (a2) a dihydroxy compound selected from the group con-sisting of C2-C6-alkanediols and C5-C10-cyclo-alkanediols, the molar ratio of (a1) to (a2) being chosen within the range from 0.4:1 to 1.5:1, and from 0.01 to 5 mol%, based on the molar quantity used of component (a1), of a compound D having at least three groups capable of ester formation.

10. A process for preparing the biodegradable polyesters P2 of claim 2, which comprises reacting a mixture consisting essentially of (b1) a mixture consisting essentially of from 20 to 95 mol% of adipic acid or ester-form-ing derivatives thereof or mixtures thereof, from 5 to 80 mol% of terephthalic acid or ester-forming derivatives thereof or mixtures thereof, and from 0 to 5 mol% of a sulfonate compound, the sum of the individual mole percentages being 100 mol%, (b2) dihydroxy compound (a2) the molar ratio of (b1) to (b2) being chosen within the range from 0.4:1 to 1.5:1, (b3) from 0.01 to 100% by weight, based on component (b1), of a hydroxycarboxylic acid B1, and (b4) from 0 to 5 mol%, based on component (b1), of compound D, the hydroxycarboxylic acid B1 being defined by the formula Ia or Ib  where p is an integer from 1 to 1500, r is an integer from 1 to 4, and G is a radical selected from the group consisting of phenylene, -(CH2)n-, where n is an integer from 1 to 5, -C(R)H- and -C(R)HCH2, where R is methyl or ethyl.

11. A process for preparing the biodegradable plolyesters Q1 of claim 3, which comprises reacting a mixture consisting essentially of:(c1) polyester P1 as claimed in claim 1, and/or a polyester PWD as claimed in claim 3, (c2) from 0.01 to 50% by weight, based on (c1), of hydroxycarboxylic acid B1, and (c3) from 0 to 5 ml%, based on component (a1) as claimed in claim 1, from the preparation of P1 as claimed in claim 1, and/or PWD as claimed in claim 3, of compound D.

12. A process for preparing the biodegradable polyesters Q2 of claim 4, which comprises reacting a mixture consisting essentially of (d1) from 95 to 99.9% by weight of polyester P1 as claimed in claim l, and/or polyester PWD as set forth in claim 3, (d2) from 0.1 to 5% by weight of a diisocyanate C1, and (d3) from 0 to 5 mol%, based on component (a1) as claimed in claim 1, from the preparation of P1 as claimed in claim 1, and/or PWD as claimed in claim 3, of compound D as claimed in claim 1, having at least three groups capable of ester formation.

13. A process for preparing the biodegradable polymers T1 of claim 5, which comprises reacting polyester Q1 as set forth in claim 3 with (e1) form 0.1 to 5% by weight, based on polyester Q1 as claimed in claim 3, of diisocyanate C1 and also with (e2) form 0 to 5 mol%, based on component (a1) as claimed in claim 1, from the preparation of polyester Q1 as claimed in claim 3, via polyester P1 as claimed in claim 1, and/or PWD as claimed in claim 3, of compound D as claimed in claim 1.

14. A process for preparing the biodegradable polymers T2 of claim 6, which comprises reacting polyester Q2 as claimed in claim 4, with:(fl) from 0.01 to 50% by weight, based on polyester Q2 as claimed in claim 4 of hydroxycarboxylic acid B1 and also with;(f2) from 0 to 5 mol%, based on component (a1) as claimed in claim 1, from the preparation of polyester Q2 as claimed in claim 4, via polyester P1 as claimed in claim 1, and/or PWDas claimed in claim 3, of compound D as claimed in claim 1.

15. A process for preparing the biodegradable polymers T3 of claim 7, which comprises reacting (g1) polyester P2 as claimed in claim 2, or (g2) a mixture consisting essentially of polyester P1 as claimed in claim 1, and from 0.01 to 50%by weight, based on polyester P1 as claimed in claim 1, of hydroxycarboxylic acid B1, or (g3) a mixture consisting essentially of polyesters P1 as claimed in claim 1, which have mutually different compositions, with from 0.1 to 5% by weight, based on the amount of polyesters used, of diisocyanate C1 and also with from 0 to 5 mol%, based on the respective molar quantities of (al) as claimed in claim 1, used for preparing the polyesters (g1) to (g3) used, of compound D as claimed in claim 1.

16. A process for preparing the biodegradable thermoplastic molding compositions T4 of claim 8, which comprises mixing from 99.5 to 0.5% by weight of polyester P1 as set forth in claim 1 or polyester Q2 as set forth in claim 4 or polyester PWD as set forth in claim 3 with from 0.5 to 99% by weight of hydroxycarboxylic acid B1.

17. The use of a biodegradable polyester as claimed in any one of claims 1 to 4 or prepared by the process of any claims 9 to 12, a biodegradable polymer as claimed in any one of claims 5 to 7 or prepared by the process of any one of claims 13 to 15, or a thermoplastic molding composition as claimed in claim 8 or prepared by the process of claim 16, for producing compostable moldings.

18. The use of a biodegradable polyester as claimed in any one of claims 1 to 4 or prepared by the process of any claims 9 to 12, a biodegradable polymer as claimed in any one of claims 5 to 7 or prepared by the process of any one of claims 13 to 15, or a thermoplastic molding composition as claimed in claim 8 or prepared by the process of claim 16, for producing adhesives.

19. Compostable moldings comprising a biodegradable polyether ester as claimed in any one of claims 1 to 4, a biodegradable polymer as claimed in any one of claims to 7, a thermoplastic molding composition as claimed in claim 8 or as prepared by the process of any one of claims 9 to 16.

20. Adhesive comprising a biodegradable polyether ester as claimed in any one of claims 1 to 4, a biodegradable polymer as claimed in any one of claims 5 to 7, a thermoplastic molding composition as claimed in claim 8 or as prepared by the process of any one of claims 9 to 16.

21. The use of a biodegradable polyester as claimed in any one of claims 1 to 4 or prepared by the process of any claims 9 to 12, a biodegradable polymer as claimed in any one of claims 5 to 7 or prepared by the process of any one of claims 13 to 15, or a thermoplastic molding composition as claimed in claim 8 or prepared by the process of claim 16, for producing biodegradable blends containing essentially the polymers according to any one of claims 1 to 8 and starch.

22. Biodegradable blends comprising a biodegradable polyether ester as claimed in any one of claims 1 to 4, a biodegradable polymer as claimed in any one of claims to 7, a thermoplastic molding composition as claimed in claim 8 or as prepared in any one of claims 9 to 16.

23. A process for producing biodegradable blends, which comprises mixing starch with the biodegradable polyester according to any one of claims 1 to 4, or of a biodegradable polymer according to any one of claims 5 to 7.

24. The use of a biodegradable polyester as claimed in any one of claims 1 to 4 or prepared by the process of any claims 9 to 12, a biodegradable polymer as claimed in any one of claims 5 to 7 or prepared by the process of any one of claims 13 to 15, or a thermoplastic molding composition as claimed in claim 8 or prepared by the process of claim 16, for producing biodegradable foams.

25. Biodegradable foams comprising a biodegradable polyether ester as claimed in any one of claims 1 to 4, a biodegradable polymer as claimed in any one of claims 5 to 7, a thermoplastic molding composition as claimed in claim 8 or as prepared by the process of any one of claims 9 to 16.
